COMMERCIAL LEASE AGREEMENT

THIS LEASE made this 1st day of January, 2020

BETWEEN:

DELTA COMMERCIAL PROPERTIES INC., a company incorporated under the laws of British Columbia
("Landlord")

AND:

RIVERSIDE RESTAURANT GROUP LTD., a company incorporated under the laws of British Columbia
("Tenant")

PREMISES: Unit 150, 7890 King George Boulevard, Surrey, BC V3W 5Y4
          Approximately 3,500 square feet

1. TERM

1.1 The term of this Lease shall be FIVE (5) YEARS commencing on January 1, 2020, and expiring on December 31, 2024 ("Initial Term").

1.2 RENEWAL OPTION: The Tenant shall have the option to renew this Lease for one additional term of FIVE (5) YEARS ("Renewal Term") on the same terms and conditions, except for rent which shall be at fair market value.

1.3 The Tenant must exercise the renewal option by providing written notice to the Landlord not less than SIX (6) MONTHS prior to the expiration of the Initial Term.

1.4 If the Tenant exercises the renewal option in accordance with this section, the Landlord shall prepare a renewal lease agreement within 30 days.

2. RENT

2.1 Base Rent: The Tenant shall pay base rent as follows:
    Year 1 (2020): $7,500.00 per month
    Year 2 (2021): $7,650.00 per month
    Year 3 (2022): $7,803.00 per month
    Year 4 (2023): $7,959.00 per month
    Year 5 (2024): $8,118.00 per month

2.2 The rent increases by 2% annually.

2.3 Rent is payable on the first day of each month.

2.4 Late payments shall incur interest at 12% per annum.

3. OPERATING COSTS

3.1 The Tenant shall pay its proportionate share of operating costs, including:
    - Property taxes
    - Building insurance
    - Common area maintenance
    - Utilities for common areas
    - Property management fees

3.2 The Tenant's proportionate share is calculated based on the Premises square footage (3,500 sq ft) divided by the total leasable area (35,000 sq ft) = 10%.

4. USE OF PREMISES

4.1 The Tenant shall use the Premises solely for the purpose of operating a full-service restaurant.

4.2 The Tenant shall obtain all necessary permits and licenses for restaurant operations.

4.3 The Tenant shall comply with all applicable laws, bylaws, and regulations.

5. LEASEHOLD IMPROVEMENTS

5.1 The Tenant may make leasehold improvements to adapt the Premises for restaurant use, subject to Landlord's prior written consent.

5.2 All improvements shall become the property of the Landlord upon termination of the Lease.

5.3 The Landlord has approved the Tenant's proposed improvements as described in Schedule "A" attached hereto.

6. MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS

6.1 The Landlord shall maintain the building structure, roof, exterior walls, and common areas.

6.2 The Tenant shall maintain the interior of the Premises, including all restaurant equipment and fixtures.

7. INSURANCE

7.1 The Tenant shall maintain:
    - Commercial general liability insurance ($2,000,000 minimum)
    - Contents and equipment insurance
    - Business interruption insurance

7.2 The Landlord shall be named as an additional insured on the Tenant's liability policy.

8. ASSIGNMENT AND SUBLETTING

8.1 The Tenant shall not assign or sublet the Premises without the Landlord's prior written consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld.

9. DEFAULT AND REMEDIES

9.1 If the Tenant defaults in payment of rent for 10 days after written notice, the Landlord may terminate the Lease.

9.2 The Landlord shall have the right to re-enter and take possession of the Premises upon termination.

10. QUIET ENJOYMENT

10.1 The Landlord covenants that if the Tenant pays rent and performs all covenants, the Tenant shall quietly enjoy the Premises without interference.

11. NOTICE

11.1 Any notice required under this Lease shall be in writing and delivered by:
     - Personal delivery
     - Registered mail
     - Email with confirmation

Landlord's Address for Notice:
Delta Commercial Properties Inc.
Suite 100, 8900 120th Street
Surrey, BC V3V 4B2
Email: legal@deltacommercial.ca

Tenant's Address for Notice:
Riverside Restaurant Group Ltd.
567 Columbia Street
New Westminster, BC V3L 1A9
Email: info@riversiderestaurants.ca

12. GENERAL

12.1 This Lease shall be governed by the laws of British Columbia.

12.2 This Lease constitutes the entire agreement between the parties.

12.3 Any amendments must be in writing and signed by both parties.

12.4 The parties agree that the Commercial Tenancy Act, S.B.C. 1996, c. 57 applies to this Lease.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF the parties have executed this Lease as of the date first written above.

DELTA COMMERCIAL PROPERTIES INC.        RIVERSIDE RESTAURANT GROUP LTD.

Per: /s/ Thomas Chen                    Per: /s/ Maria Rodriguez
     Thomas Chen, President                  Maria Rodriguez, President

Date: January 1, 2020                   Date: January 1, 2020
